name: Stone Gossard
description:
'''Stone Carpenter Gossard''' (born July 20, 1966) is an American musician and songwriter who serves as the rhythm guitarist for the rock band [[Pearl Jam]]. Along with [[Jeff Ament]], [[Mike McCready]], and [[Eddie Vedder]], he is one of the founding members of the band.

Gossard is also known for his work prior to Pearl Jam with the Seattle-based [[grunge]] bands [[Green River (band)|Green River]] and [[Mother Love Bone]]. Gossard was also a member of the bands [[Temple of the Dog]] and [[Brad (band)|Brad]]. In addition to his performing career, he has been active in the music industry as a producer and the owner of a record label and recording studio.  He released his first solo album ''[[Bayleaf (album)|Bayleaf]]'' in 2001; his second, ''Moonlander'', followed in 2013.

Gossard was inducted into the [[Rock and Roll Hall of Fame]] as a member of Pearl Jam in 2017.
